text:
Hey Samantha, how are you doing? I have a question- can I not specialise in more than one type of physiotherapy?

I have had some reflection time in the past few weeks and this is what I came up with:

So my plan would be then to do physio at a respected uni, start my career by 21, as I already have plans of travelling when I grow up I will do that and also get paid. I will see how that goes and if I would like to keep on travelling. If I like it, then I'll continue until I'm 23-24. After that I would like to settle down here, perhaps either work in the NHS or a private sector, and go up the ladder. The pay doesn't sound too bad, 28k average in the first year, and could go upto 60k.

What do you think of this?

I have also taken into account how you said I was aiming low, and to be honest I couldn't agree more now that I think about it. I think I have a fear of failure, if I want something I really want it and if I don't get it then I get upset and mock myself for not being enough to get there. Its pretty toxic and something I should get rid of really.
Brunel will probably be in my list but my main one would be St George's as it is a top uni for physio
As always thank you for the advice I really appreciate it:heart:

And I am still acting like I would like to do medicine, I still am doing voluntary work and all that, I even signed upto a conference from Imperial for next month. At this point I'm just going with the flow, I don't think medicine is for me but I'll carry on because attending these activities have given me many chances like work experience at a hospital which I probably would have never got if I didn't get accepted into the programme.

The reason why I think medicine is not for me:
1. 5-6 years, by the time I graduate all my friends would probably be settling down and I'll be behind

2. That means a debt of 54k, that's a mountain of debt that doesn't sound pleasant at all

3. Starting salary as a gp is 30k, and that's after 6 years, with physio I'll be doing half of that and get almost the same amount

4. Content is hard, I don't want to keep on eating books for the rest of my life

5. Overworking hours, sometimes you may not even get paid

6. I want to settle down when I'm around 23-24. However before that I would like to start my career, so that's doesn't seem possible.
I'm sorry for the 50 mark essay haha but just had to let my thoughts out, do you think I'm being rational?
